hypotheses: H*: The introduction of social distancing measures is associated with a decrease in mobility
claim.statement: social distancing measures introduced by governments during the 2020 pandemic reduced the mobility in the concerned cities.

data.source: Citymapper Mobility Index from March 2, 2020 to March 26, 2020
data.notes: The analysis focuses on urban settings and public transport users only.

method.description: The study analyzed the effect of social distancing measures on mobility using data from the Citymapper Mobility Index, employing a multilevel mixed-effects linear regression model to estimate impact.
steps: Download mobility data from Citymapper Mobility Index for March 2-26, 2020.
Tabulate data on social distancing measures from official and media sources.
Classify cities by the intensity of social distancing measures.
Estimate effects using a multilevel mixed-effects linear regression model.

results.summary: The study found that social distancing measures decreased mobility by an additional 23%, with no difference based on measure intensity. Mobility decreased by 3.4% per day on average.

numerical_results.outcome_name: Effect of social distancing measures on mobility

metadata.original_paper_title: COVID-19 related social distancing measures and reduction in city mobility
